meanings.definition: A person or thing that lubricates.
meanings.sent1: The lubricator poured oil into the engine to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used a lubricator to oil the gears of the machine.
meanings.sent3: The little robot claimed to be the best lubricator in town, always ready to oil squeaky hinges.
meanings.sent4: She was like a lubricator for the team, always smoothing out conflicts and keeping things moving.
meanings.sent5: The old man's hands moved like a skilled lubricator, ensuring everything stayed well-oiled.

meanings.definition: A device for applying lubricant to a machine or vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The lubricator attached to the assembly line kept the conveyor belt well-oiled.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to refill the lubricator regularly to prevent any machinery breakdowns.
meanings.sent3: The automated lubricator went on strike, causing a hilarious chain reaction of squeaky machines.
meanings.sent4: The lubricator hummed softly as it spread oil, like a gentle touch on the machine's parts.
meanings.sent5: The bright red lubricator stood out in the workshop, a beacon of maintenance and care.
